entries.name: SophonZkEvm
entries.description: The main contract defining the Layer 2. Operator actions like commiting blocks, providing ZK proofs and executing batches ultimately target this contract which then processes transactions. During batch execution it processes L1 --> L2 and L2 --> L1 transactions.

issuedPermissions.description: commit, prove, execute, revert batches directly in the main Diamond contract. This role is typically held by a proxying ValidatorTimelock.
commit, prove, execute, revert batches directly in the main Diamond contract. This role is typically held by a proxying ValidatorTimelock.
manage fees, apply predefined upgrades, manage censorship through a TransactionFilterer, set DA mode, migrate the chain to whitelisted settlement layers (Chain Admin role).

getTransactionFilterer.description: This contract must expose the ITransactionFilterer interface (see Mailbox facet) and is used for censoring transactions pushed from L1 to L2.

IsPorterAvailableStatus.description: zkPorter is a volition-like contruction and changes the zk proof input requirements.

isPermanentRollup.description: true means that the DA mode cannot be changed to Validium in the future. compliant DAValidator pairs for the permanent rollup mode are defined/enforced by the RollupDAManager contract.

getProtocolVersion.description: Protocol version, increments with each protocol upgrade.

getVerifierParams.description: Verifier parameters used for proving batches.

arg.1: . isPermanentRollup was set to true in this contract which prevents changing the DA mode to Validium in the future.

entries.name: ValidatorTimelock2
entries.description: Intermediary contract between the *Validators* and the central diamond contract that delays block execution (ie withdrawals and other L2 --> L1 messages) by 3h.

receivedPermissions.description: commit, prove, execute, revert batches directly in the main Diamond contract. This role is typically held by a proxying ValidatorTimelock.

entries.name: ValidatorTimelock
entries.description: Intermediary contract between the *Validators* and the central diamond contract that delays block execution (ie withdrawals and other L2 --> L1 messages) by 3h.

receivedPermissions.description: commit, prove, execute, revert batches directly in the main Diamond contract. This role is typically held by a proxying ValidatorTimelock.

entries.name: ValidiumL1DAValidator
entries.description: Contract that 'verifies' the data availability for validiums. This implementation only checks the correct formatting and does not serve as a DA oracle. Can be used by ZK stack validiums as the L1 part of a DAValidator pair.

entries.name: Verifier
entries.description: Implements the ZK proof verification logic.

receivedPermissions.description: set the conversion factor for gas token deposits.

issuedPermissions.description: set the conversion factor for gas token deposits.

directlyReceivedPermissions.description: manage fees, apply predefined upgrades, manage censorship through a TransactionFilterer, set DA mode, migrate the chain to whitelisted settlement layers (Chain Admin role).

upgradeTimestamps.description: Timestamps for new protocol version upgrades can be registered here (NOT enforced)

receivedPermissions.description: manage fees, apply predefined upgrades, manage censorship through a TransactionFilterer, set DA mode, migrate the chain to whitelisted settlement layers (Chain Admin role).
